Faults.message:
We're aware of a fault causing customers in the area to be without power. We expect the cause of this to be from the adverse weather across our network at the moment. We've been tracking this weather for several days and have additional teams on hand to respond. It's possible that this weather has caused damage to our network and our teams will need to repair this as and when it's safe to do so.

Our local engineers have been informed this area is without power and are working hard to get the lights back on. We will continue to issue updates to the restoration time here and suggest you register for updates on this page so we can notify you if anything changes.

Thank you for your patience and if you need any help or additional information in the meantime, please call us by dialling 105 or send us a message on Facebook.
Faults.name: W3 Area

Faults.message:
We're aware of a fault on our local network affecting several homes. This means that you and some of your neighbours will be affected by the power cut, but not all - this is why you may notice some of your neighbours have power when you do not. Its not uncommon to see 1 in 3 homes affected.

Our engineers are in your local area and working hard to get your power restored as soon as possible. At this stage, based on initial investigations, we're aiming to restore your power by 04:00 02/01/2025. If this changes, we will update this message.

The cause of this power cut is a fault on our underground network. This is the most common type of fault we see, and our teams are very experienced in dealing with these issues. In most cases, our engineers are able to get your power back on by simply replacing a fuse at the local substation, however, if the fault is severe, this may take us longer to fix. If this does happen, we will let you know.

If you need more information, please send us a message on Whatsapp or call us on 105 and quote reference 'QB6269'
Faults.name: SP10 Area

Faults.message:
We're aware of a power cut in the area shown, affecting 665 homes. This unplanned fault is affecting a large area, and it's likely several streets in your area are affected by the same power cut.

Our engineers are in your local area and working hard to get your power restored as soon as possible. At this stage, based on initial investigations, we're aiming to restore your power by 01:00 02/01/2025. If this changes, we will update this message.

The cause of this power cut is a fault on our underground network. This is the most common type of fault we see, and our teams are very experienced in dealing with these issues. In most cases, our engineers are able to get your power back on by simply replacing a fuse at the local substation, however, if the fault is severe, this may take us longer to fix.
